item.title: Report E-2024060425
item.description:
Report E-2024060425

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-01
  • City: NEW HARTFORD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5100
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE SHIPPING FROM NEW HARTFORD, NY TO SYRACUSE, NY BROKE OPEN REQUIRING A PACKAGE REWRAP. UPON INSPECTION A MC LEOD GAGE DEVICE CONTAINING MERCURY HAD BROKEN. AN OUTSIDE RESPONSE TEAM WAS CONTACTED. THE OUTSIDE RESPONDER CONTAINED, CLEANED, AND REMOVED THE PACKAGE AND CONTENTS FROM THE FACILITY. NO EVACUATION OF THE FACILITY WAS NEEDED AND NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED. THE OUTSIDE RESPONDER ADVISED AN ESTIMATED FIVE POUNDS OF MERCURY WAS CONTAINED IN THE MC LEOD GAGE DEVICE WITH APPROXIMATELY 30 ML (1 OZ) OF MERCURY RELEASING. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS OFFERED FOR AIR SERVICE BUT ONLY MOVED IN THE GROUND NETWORK PRIOR TO THE LEAKAGE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024060407
item.description:
Report E-2024060407

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 3-ounces of Bostik 1231J was released from one (1) 5-gallon metal drum impacting the trailer floor. The cause was due to a forklift accident. ERTS reviewed the SDS with terminal personnel, a contractor was advised but decline by the terminal. The terminal cleaned the impacted area with the available PPE on site. The waste was containerized into one (1) 35-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061114
item.description:
Report X-2024061114

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: EAST SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER DONNED PPE AND TOOK SPILL CART TO PINK BELT FOR HAZARD LEAKER. FOUND CORROSIVE BOX WITH WET SIDES AT TOP OF BELT. USED PH PAPER TO CHECK FOR ACIDITY AND DETERMINED LEAKER TO BE A BASE ACID. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET TO CHECK FOR HAZARD RESPONSE PROCEEDURES. USED ZEP ZORB AND LINED SPILL TRAY TO TRANSPORT BOX TO DAMAGE CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024060432
item.description:
Report X-2024060432

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: JAMAICA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/5/2024 at approximately 1900, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4009660 at the ramp facility in Jamacia NY, reporting an undeclared battery shipment. The shipment consisted of 4 cardboard containers wrapped in black shrinkwrap, each filled with used and damaged cell phones. None of the packages were properly declared as UN3481 Lithium ion batteries contained in equipment Section I. The shipment was not prepared in accourdance with IATA Regulation. The entire shipment was held pending an investigation by the FAA.

item.title: Report I-2024050082
item.description:
Report I-2024050082

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: KIRKWOOD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: The New York Susquehanna and Western Railway
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 22000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: A FREIGHT TRAIN OPERATED BY THE NYSW RAILWAY, WAS TRAVELING EAST THROUGITHE TOWN OF KIRKWOOD, NY. A FARM TRACTOR ENTERED THE ROW AS IT DID NOT STOP AT A CROSSING. THE TRACTOR WAS STRUCK BY THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE. WHEN THE TRACTOR WAS STRUCK, A PIECE FROM THE TRACTOR BROKE OFF, AND FLEW INTO THE SIDE OF THE FUEL TANK CAUSING A GASH. DISEL FUEL LEAKED FROM THE GASH. NYSW AND LOCAL EMS PERSONAL RESPONDED, AND PLACED MATERIALS IN THE GASH TO STOP THE FUEL FROM LEAKING. APPROX. DURATION OF THE LEAK, 10 MINUTES.

MAANGER CALLED QA. PACKAGE WAS RECOVERED, INSPECTED, CONTAINED IN HAZMAT DRUM REPORTS FILED 06/05/24. ORIGINAL REPORT 9711 WAS SUBMITTED ON 06/05/24.

item.title: Report X-2024060301

item.title: Report X-2024060932
item.description:
Report X-2024060932

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-23
  • City: ROCHESTER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/22/2024 at approximately 1900, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 5204557 at the ramp facility in Rochester, reporting a spilled undeclared postal package. The shipment appeared to consist of one fiberboard box. Based on the attached documentation, the commodity appears to be paint thinner, however, we are unable to confirm because the shipment is a postal package. Postal has taken possession of the shipment and the aiarcraft was been cleaned from the spill. Aircraft maintinance has cleared the aircraft for service.
